definition: Properties or characteristics that describe mathematical, scientific, or engineering aspects of systems, equations, or technical objects.

positive_examples: The differential equation exhibits nonlinear behavior in its solution space.
We need to analyze the multipole characteristics of this electromagnetic field configuration.
The system's algebraic-differential properties make it suitable for control theory applications.
This equation's degree and linearity properties determine the solution method.
The technical specifications include various mathematical attributes of the model.
Engineers must consider the nonlinear properties when designing the feedback system.
negative_examples: The color of the material is bright red and very appealing.
She has a friendly personality and great communication skills.
The building's architectural style reflects modern design principles.
His emotional response to the news was quite understandable.
The cultural significance of this tradition cannot be overstated.
The price of the product has increased due to market demand.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PhysicalAttribute, QualitativeAttribute, SocialAttribute, TemporalAttribute
